adATLASUnitIfNumber.name: adATLASUnitIfNumber
adATLASUnitIfNumber.description: The number of physical interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system. The same as ifNumber defined in the MIB-2 interfaces group.

adATLASUnitPortInfoTable.name: adATLASUnitPortInfoTable
adATLASUnitPortInfoTable.description: A table of hardware oriented port information on each card. This only includes actual card ports, and not layered logical interfaces.

adATLASUnitPortInfoEntry.name: adATLASUnitPortInfoEntry
adATLASUnitPortInfoEntry.description: A row table entry exists for each card/port pair.

adATLASUnitPortStatus.name: adATLASUnitPortStatus
adATLASUnitPortStatus.description: The current status of the port.

adATLASUnitPortIfIndex.name: adATLASUnitPortIfIndex
adATLASUnitPortIfIndex.description: The interface number identified as ifIndex from the MIB-II interfaces table as defined by the slot and port numbers in this device.

adATLASUnitPortDescription.name: adATLASUnitPortDescription
adATLASUnitPortDescription.description: A character string to identify the name of a port.

adATLASUnitPortSlotMapTable.name: adATLASUnitPortSlotMapTable
adATLASUnitPortSlotMapTable.description: Table to map ifIndex to slot and port.

adATLASUnitPortSlotMapEntry.name: adATLASUnitPortSlotMapEntry
adATLASUnitPortSlotMapEntry.description: An entry exists for each interface which is mapped to a physical slot/port pair.

adATLASUnitSlotAddress.name: adATLASUnitSlotAddress
adATLASUnitSlotAddress.description: The slot in which this port is contained. Slot 0 is reported for the system controller and all logical interfaces.

adATLASUnitPortAddress.name: adATLASUnitPortAddress
adATLASUnitPortAddress.description: The port number within the slot. Port 0 is reported for all logical interfaces.

adATLASUpdateFwModuleNum.name: adATLASUpdateFwModuleNum
adATLASUpdateFwModuleNum.description: The slot containing the module to be updated with the firmware. If -1 is returned, no slot has been selected.

adATLASUpdateFwTFTPSrvAddr.name: adATLASUpdateFwTFTPSrvAddr
adATLASUpdateFwTFTPSrvAddr.description: The IP address of the TFTP server.

adATLASUpdateFwTFTPSrvFileName.name: adATLASUpdateFwTFTPSrvFileName
adATLASUpdateFwTFTPSrvFileName.description: The name of the file to transfer from the TFTP server.

adATLASUpdateFwCurrStatus.name: adATLASUpdateFwCurrStatus
adATLASUpdateFwCurrStatus.description: Status of the current firmware update.

adATLASUpdateFwPrevStatus.name: adATLASUpdateFwPrevStatus
adATLASUpdateFwPrevStatus.description: Status of the previous firmware update.

adATLASUpdateFwControl.name: adATLASUpdateFwControl
adATLASUpdateFwControl.description: Start the firmware update by setting value to 1 and stop the firmware update in progress by setting value to 2. The value will be 2 if a firmware update is in progress, and 1 otherwise.

adATLASConfigXferTFTPSrvAddr.name: adATLASConfigXferTFTPSrvAddr
adATLASConfigXferTFTPSrvAddr.description: The IP address of the TFTP server.

adATLASConfigXferTFTPSrvFileName.name: adATLASConfigXferTFTPSrvFileName
adATLASConfigXferTFTPSrvFileName.description: The name of the file to transfer to/from the TFTP server.

adATLASConfigXferCurrStatus.name: adATLASConfigXferCurrStatus
adATLASConfigXferCurrStatus.description: Status of the current configuration transfer.

adATLASConfigXferPrevStatus.name: adATLASConfigXferPrevStatus
adATLASConfigXferPrevStatus.description: Status of the previous configuration transfer.

adATLASConfigXferDwnldControl.name: adATLASConfigXferDwnldControl
adATLASConfigXferDwnldControl.description: Set value to 1 to transfer the configuration file from the TFTP server and switch to the configuration.

adATLASConfigXferUpldControl.name: adATLASConfigXferUpldControl
adATLASConfigXferUpldControl.description: Set value to 1 to transfer the configuration file to the TFTP server.

adATLASUnitFPStatus.name: adATLASUnitFPStatus
adATLASUnitFPStatus.description: A bit-encoded variable that gives the overall front panel status of the Atlas product. It is encoded as follows: OFF 0x00 OK 0x01 ONLINE 0x02 TESTING 0x04 FLASH DOWNLOAD 0x08 ERROR 0x10 ALARM 0x20 STANDBY 0x40 WARN 0x80 Note: Multiple bits may be set concurrently, based on the current state of the modules contained within the Atlas product.

adATLASFrSwToBkup.name: adATLASFrSwToBkup
adATLASFrSwToBkup.description: This trap indicates that the indicated Virtual Circuit has switched to a backup state.

adATLASFrSwToPrimary.name: adATLASFrSwToPrimary
adATLASFrSwToPrimary.description: This trap indicates that the indicated Virtual Circuit has been restored to the primary state.
